caption: Table 1: Comparison of our models to baselines. The results are averaged over 10 independent experiments performed by resampling the training sets and model initial parameters. The RMSE and the VPT are recorded in the scale of ×10-2 and in the form of mean ± standard deviation. Bold font indicates best results.
description: This table compares the performance of the proposed HHD-GP and SPHHD-GP models against several baseline models on two benchmark dynamical systems: a damped mass-spring system and a damped pendulum.  The comparison is based on three metrics: Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) for derivative prediction, Valid Prediction Time (VPT) indicating the duration of accurate trajectory prediction, and Mean Negative Log Likelihood (MNLL) representing prediction uncertainty.  The results are averaged over multiple independent experiments, showcasing the robustness and superior performance of the proposed models.

caption: Table 1: Comparison of our models to baselines. The results are averaged over 10 independent experiments performed by resampling the training sets and model initial parameters. The RMSE and the VPT are recorded in the scale of ×10-2 and in the form of mean ± standard deviation. Bold font indicates best results.
description: This table compares the performance of the proposed HHD-GP and SPHHD-GP models against several baseline models on two benchmark dynamical systems: damped mass-spring and damped pendulum.  The evaluation metrics include Root Mean Squared Error (RMSE) for state derivative prediction, Valid Prediction Time (VPT) for trajectory prediction, and Mean Negative Log-Likelihood (MNLL) for prediction uncertainty.  Lower RMSE and MNLL values indicate better performance, while a higher VPT value indicates more accurate long-term prediction. The results are averaged over multiple runs with resampled training data and model parameters, demonstrating the robustness and generalizability of the proposed approach.
